001package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
002
003import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D50;
004import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D65;
005
006import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
007
008/**
009 * <p>
010 * Implementation of a D65-based XYZ color space, as a substitute for Java's
011 * built-in standard connection space (obtained with
012 * {@code  ColorSpace.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_CIEXYZ)}), with improved
013 * accuracy. The reference white point of this color space is D50 and any XYZ
014 * coordinate passed to {@link #fromCIEXYZ(float[])} is assumed to be relative
015 * to D50 as well, thus no conversion (color adaptation) is necessary between
016 * XYZ values. See Sec. 14.1.1 of [1] for details.
017 * </p>
018 * <p>
019 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
020 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
021 * </p>
022 * 
023 * @author WB
024 * @version 2022/11/14
025 * @see XYZ50ColorSpace
026 */
027@SuppressWarnings("serial")
028public class XYZ65ColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion {
029        private static sRgbColorSpace srgbCS = sRgbColorSpace.getInstance();
030        
031        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D65, D50);
032        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
033
034        
035        private static final XYZ65ColorSpace instance = new XYZ65ColorSpace();
036        public static XYZ65ColorSpace getInstance() {
037                return instance;
038        }
039
040        private XYZ65ColorSpace() {
041                super(TYPE_XYZ, 3);
042        }
043
044        // ----------------------------------------------------
045
046        @Override       // convert this D65.based XYZ to sRGB 
047        public float[] toRGB(float[] thisXYZ65) {
048                float[] XYZ50 = this.toCIEXYZ(thisXYZ65);       // could be done directly!!
049                float[] srgb = srgbCS.fromCIEXYZ(XYZ50);
050                return srgb;
051        }
052
053        @Override
054        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
055                float[] XYZ50 = srgbCS.toCIEXYZ(srgb);
056                return this.fromCIEXYZ(XYZ50);
057        }
058        
059        // -------------------------------------------------
060        
061        @Override       // convert this CS D65 XYZ to standard D50 XYZ
062        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] thisXYZ65) {
063                return catD65toD50.applyTo(thisXYZ65);
064        }
065        
066        @Override       // convert standard D50 XYZ to this CS D65 XYZ
067        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {
068                return catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);
069        }
070        
071        // -------------------------------------------------
072
073        @Override
074        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] xyz65) {
075                return xyz65;
076        }
077
078        @Override
079        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] xyz65) {
080                return xyz65;
081        }
082
083}
